greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(1)=1; thereafter, if n is k-th number whose greatest prime factor has an odd index [i.e., n = A244991(k)], a(n) = 2*a(k), otherwise, when n is k-th number whose greatest prime factor has an even index [i.e., n = A244990(1+k)], a(n) = 1+(2*a(k)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: a(1) = 1, and for n > 1, if A244992(n) = 1 [i.e. the greatest prime factor of n has an odd index], a(n) = 2 * A244321(A244989(n)), otherwise, a(n) = 1 + (2 * A244321(A244988(n)-1)).
xref: Similar entanglement permutations: A135141, A237427, A243287, A243343, A243345.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 22 2014
